Straight Shot smiles to Perceptor and puts a friendly hand on his shoulder.=


" If anyone can secure this base, it's you and Legacy.  I highly doubt Hy=
dras is gonna be able ta stick all of his snouts in our business too easill=
y after you do the upgrades."

She smiles as she watches Rodimus and Tucson=
 together, now sharing a moment of friendship as it should be amongst Autob=
ot Commanders.

Tucson gives a casual smile to Rodimus. It was like old tim=
es.  They had fought hard together before and now, with Rodimus back safely=
 he was assured that there would be nothing that would stand in the way of =
their friendship.

" I want you to know that this time, Rodimus, I won't le=
t anyone or anything stand in the way of our comradship.  I learned a great=
 deal the day I was taken off line.  I learned to watch my back at all time=
s, and never to let my guard down.  So if anyone dares to cross our line ag=
ain, there will be a serious lesson to be learned.  But, that lesson is twi=
ce learned when it comes from two Primes instead of just one.  As soon as I=
'm fully operational, of course, I - think it would benefit all of us, if w=
e had a more substantial base of operations."

Straight Shot looks over to =
them.

"Heeey, sorta like Metroplex in the past..  Of course, there aren't =
any transformers that size anymore huh?"

Tucson nodds.

"That's right.  Bu=
t it doesn't mean it has to stop us from creating a base of operations.  I'=
d like to also preserve the land in it's purity.  Perhaps create something =
that intergrates with the environment. "

Quickstride listens in.

"Oh, sor=
t of an organic base but sort of not.  Kind of.. Ya know, that might be doa=
ble.  Maximal bases are like that, and I'm sure we can find materials for i=
t without upsetting anything or anyone.  And we can always power the base w=
ith solar pannels, so that way we don't drain the planet of it's natural re=
sources.  And if we need to create a fuel source, why not go botanical? Non=
 chemical means no pollution."

Tucson chuckles.

" I like the sound of tha=
t.  But first, I think we have more important issues to deal with.  Hydras.=
.  For now, the Ark alone will have to do, but in time, we can think of exp=
anding our base of operations, perhaps convert it to residential quarters, =
where we can be assured safety.  Again, this will have to come in time."

H=
e staggers somewhat, and points to the CR Chambers.

" I - better not waste=
 any more time getting to the CR chambers."

He slowly makes his way over t=
o the CR chambers, and makes it to a large booth, where he sits down and th=
en lies back.  With a sigh, it's not long before he goes into a sleep mode.=
  At last, he listens to his systems and settles down for a much deserved r=
echarge.

 However any security concerns have to be weighed

anges to the temporal continuum."
